global.initEdgeRc: Check if your .edgerc file and section are specified correctly and contain valid credentials.
global.invalidCommandInput: Incorrect command. Either correct the input following examples or provide JSON input file for the command and try again.
global.invalidJsonInput: Invalid JSON input. Correct it and try again.
global.500: Internal server error. Try again later.
global.504: Request timed out. Try again later.
global.405: Method not allowed. Try again later.

edgeGridError.resourceNotFound: The requested resource can't be found.
edgeGridError.httpsRequired: HTTPS is required in the host.
edgeGridError.invalidTimestamp: The system time for API Client is incorrect. Check system's clock synced with a time authority.
edgeGridError.notAuthorized: The identity is not authorized to manage any context.
edgeGridError.invalidAuthorizationClientToken: The authorization client token is invalid.
edgeGridError.invalidAuthorizationAccessToken: The authorization access token is invalid.
edgeGridError.theSignatureDoesNotMatch: The signature doesn't match client secret.
edgeGridError.theHostHeaderIsNotValidServiceConsumerTo: The host header is not a valid service consumer token.

testCenter.long:
Test Center is a testing tool that checks the effect of configuration changes 
on your web property. Use Test Center as part of your testing protocol to increase 
your confidence in the safety and accuracy of your configuration changes.
testCenter.edgerc: Sets the new path to the .edgerc file. Provide the full path.
testCenter.section: Sets the new section name of the .edgerc file with credentials for the CLI to use.
testCenter.accountKey: Switches to the account with specific Account ID when performing operations.

conditions.long: This command lists condition statements that you can use when creating test cases. Make sure to substitute default " " with your own.

invalid.argumentPassed: Invalid %q subcommand for %q. Correct your input and try again.

testSuite.short: List commands available for test suites.
testSuite.long:
Test suites act as containers for functional test cases. You can create, edit, or remove test suites, 
manage test suites using JSON input, add test cases to test suites, and generate a default test suite for a particular property.

add.long:
This command creates a test suite. Test suites act as containers for functional test cases. You can add a name and 
description to a test suite to provide more details about it and the 
included test cases. You can also set if the test suite needs to be locked or 
stateful. Test suites can be associated with a property version.

In stateful test suites, test cases are executed in the order they are added and 
cookies and session information are retained for subsequent test cases.

Locked test suites can be modified only by their editors and owners.
add.name: Name of the test suite.
add.unlocked: Optional. Unlocks the test suite. By default, all test suites are locked.
add.stateful: Optional. Sets the test suite to stateful. By default test suites are stateless.
add.property: Optional. Property name you want the test suite to be associated with, for example 'example.com'. This flag needs to be combined with the '--propver' flag.
add.propver: Optional. Property version you want the test suite to be associated with, for example '4'. This flag needs to be combined with the '--property' flag.

missing.name: Missing the required '--name' flag. Add the flag and try again.
missing.propertyVersion: Missing one of the flags, either '--property' or '--propver'. Correct your input and try again.

invalid.propertyVersion: Invalid '--property' or '--propver' flag value. Enter a valid property name and its version and try again. Example: --property 'example.com'  --propver '4'

validationError.invalidValue: The '{{requestField}}' is invalid or it's an empty string. Correct your input and try again.
validationError.maxLengthExceeded: The '{{requestField}}' exceeds the allowed characters limit.
validationError.entityAlreadyExists: The test suite with such name already exists. Provide a new name and try again.

authorizationError.requiredPermissionMissing: You don't have the WRITE permission, which is required to access the test suites. Contact your Account administrator.

add.invalidRequestBody: Invalid request. Correct the input following examples and try again.

invalid.argumentPassed: Invalid %q subcommand for %q. Correct your input and try again.

edit.long: This command edits a test suite with a specific ID. Provide only flags with values you want to edit in the current test suite.
edit.id: Unique identifier of the test suite you want to edit.
edit.name: Optional. Edited name of the test suite.
edit.stateful: Optional. Sets the test suite to be stateful.
edit.stateless: Optional. Sets the test suite to be stateless.
edit.property: Optional. Property name you want the test suite to be associated to, for example 'example.com'. This flag needs to be combined with the '--propver' flag.
edit.propver: Optional. Property version you want the test suite to be associated to, for example '4'. This flag needs to be combined with the '--property' flag.
edit.removeProperty: Optional. Removes test suite's current association to the property version. If applicable, provide either this flag or '--property' and '--propver'.

missing.flagOrJsonImport: Missing required flags or JSON input. Correct the input following examples and try again.
missing.id: Missing the required '--id' flag. Add the flag and try again.
missing.propertyVersion: Missing one of the flags, either '--property' or '--propver'. Correct your input and try again.

invalid.all: Invalid request. At least one provided value needs to be different from current settings of the test suite.
invalid.id: Invalid test suite ID value. It needs to be a number. To get this value, run the 'test-suite list' command. Correct the input and try again.
invalid.propertyVersion: Invalid '--property' or '--propver' flag value. Enter a valid property name and its version and try again. Example: --property 'example.com'  --propver '4'
invalid.removeProperty: Invalid '--property', '--propver' and '--remove-property' flags usage. Provide either '--remove-property' or '--property' and '--propver' and try again.
invalid.lockedUnlocked: Invalid '--locked' and '--unlocked' flags usage. Provide either '--locked' or '--unlocked' and try again.
invalid.statefulStateless: Invalid '--stateful' and '--stateless' flags usage. Provide either '--stateful' or '--stateless' and try again.

authorizationError.requiredPermissionMissing: You don't have the WRITE permission, which is required to access the test suites. Contact your Account administrator.
authorizationError.userIsNotOwnerOrEditor: You don't have the Edit access to this test suite. Request the Edit access using the Test Center UI and try again once your request is approved.

validationError.alreadyAssociatedToRequirement: This test suite is already associated with a requirement. Test suites can be associated either to a requirement or a property version, not both. Remove the association or select a different test suite and try again.
validationError.resourceInDeletedState: You can't edit this test suite because it's in the deleted state. Restore it and try again.
validationError.testRunsInProgress: You can't edit test suites involved in a test run in progress. Wait until the test run is complete and try again.
validationError.entityAlreadyExists: The test suite with such name already exists. Provide a new name and try again.
validationError.existingAssociatedTestCasesHaveDifferent: In a stateful test suite you can add only functional test cases that use the same client profile as the test cases already included in this test suite.
validationError.onlyOwnerCanChangeLockedStatus: You can't edit the Locked status because you don't have the Owners access. Request it using the Test Center UI and try again once your request is approved.
validationError.invalidValue: The '{{requestField}}' is invalid or it's an empty string. Correct your input and try again.
validationError.maxLengthExceeded: The '{{requestField}}' exceeds the allowed characters limit. Correct your input and try again.

update.invalidRequestBody: Invalid request. Correct the input following examples and try again.

authorizationError.requiredPermissionMissing: You don't have the READ permission, which is required to get the test suite. Contact your Account administrator.

read.resourceNotFound: The test suite with this ID can't be found. Run the 'test-suite list' command to verify the ID and try again.

invalid.argumentPassed: Invalid %q subcommand for %q. Correct your input and try again.

list.short: Lists test suites available for your account.
list.long: This command lists test suites available for your account. You can filter the results by user, property the test suite is associated with, or a string from test suite's name or description. The list includes also the recently deleted test suites that you can restore.
list.property: Optional. Filters the list for a property name the test suite is associated with, for example 'example.com_pm'.
list.propver: Optional. Filters the list for a property version the test suite is associated with, for example '4'. This flag needs to be combined with the '--property' flag.
list.user: Optional. Filters the list for a username who created, modified, or deleted the test suite.
list.search: Optional. Filters the list for a string value present in a test suite's name or description.

invalid.propertyVersion: Invalid '--propver' flag value or usage. It needs to be a number and it needs to be used together with the '--property' flag. Correct the input and try again.

authorizationError.requiredPermissionMissing: You don't have the READ permission, which is required to view the test suites. Contact your Account administrator.

list.validationError: The '{{requestField}}' is missing for the property.

import.long: This command imports a test suite from a JSON file or standard JSON input.

missing.json: Missing JSON data. Pass the JSON data and try again.

invalid.json: Failed to import the test suite from entered JSON data. Correct the input following examples and try again.

authorizationError.requiredPermissionMissing: You don't have the READ permission, which is required to view the test suites. Contact your Account administrator.

import.hostnameAccessMissing: You don't have access to all the hostnames of included test cases. Get the access or edit the hostnames and try again.
import.duplicateResourceInPayload: The requested '{{requestField}}' has some duplicates. Remove the duplicates and try again.
import.urlShouldContainPath: Missing path in the URL. Correct the URL and try again.
import.urlPathShouldContainAlphabeticCharacters: Failed to create a test case for the 'Ignore case in cache key' condition. The URL is missing alphabetic characters. Edit the URL and try again.
import.urlShouldContainQueryParam: Failed to create a test case for the 'Ignore case in cache key' condition. The URL is missing query parameters. Edit the URL and try again.
import.dataTypeMismatch: The value of a variable in condition doesn't match the expected data type of the condition. Verify the entered condition and the value and try again.
import.invalidCharacterFound: The requested '{{requestField}}' contains invalid characters. Correct the values and try again.
import.malformedExpressionFound: The requested '{{requestField}}' contains malformed expressions. Correct the values and try again.
import.invalidConditionExpression: The requested '{{requestField}}' contains invalid conditions. Verify the entered values, format, and type and try again.
import.customValueNotSupported: Invalid condition statement. You can only use default available values for this condition. Use the condition template to create a valid condition and try again.

generateDefault.short: Generates a default test suite for a specific property version.
generateDefault.long: This command generates a default test suite for a property version using provided URLs. Based on property settings and its behaviors and the '--url' flag value, Test Center generates a test suite object with test cases and variables for you to modify and add to Test Center using the 'test-suite import' command.
generateDefault.property: Property name you want to generate the test suite for, for example 'example.com'. This flag needs to be combined with the '--propver' flag.
generateDefault.propver: Property version you want to generate the test suite for, for example '4'. This flag needs to be combined with the '--property' flag.
generateDefault.url: Fully qualified URL to be included in the generated test suite. Repeat this flag to provide more than one URL.

missing.url: Missing the required '--url' flag. Add the flag and try again.
missing.propertyVersion: Missing at least one of the required flags, '--property' and '--propver'. Provide all required data and try again.
missing.flagOrJsonImport: Missing required flags or JSON input. Correct the input following examples and try again.

invalid.propertyVersion: Invalid '--property' or '--propver' flag value. Enter a valid property name and its version and try again. Example: --property 'example.com'  --propver '4'
invalid.url: Invalid URL value. It needs to contain the protocol, hostname, path, and any applicable string parameters. For example 'https://www.example.com'. Correct your input and try again.

authorizationError.requiredPermissionMissing: You don't have the WRITE permission, which is required to generate the default test suite. Contact your Account administrator.

validationError.hostnameAccessMissingForGivenConfig: These hostnames doesn't belong to the given property version: '{{requestValues}}'.
validationError.invalidValue: The '{{requestField}}' is invalid or it's an empty string. Correct your input and try again.

manage.short: Updates an existing test suite using a JSON file or standard JSON input.
manage.long: This command updates an existing test suite using a JSON file or standard JSON input. Provide the whole test suite object, together with test cases and variables, to include in Test Center. Only data provided in the latest JSON input will be saved.

view.short: Returns details of a specific test suite.
view.long: This command returns details of a test suite with a specific ID: test suite overview, included test cases, and association with a property version.
view.id: Unique identifier of the test suite you want to get the details of. Run the 'test-suite list' command to get this value. Provide one of these flags, either '--id' or '--name'.
view.name: Name of the test suite you want ot get the details of. Run the 'test-suite list' command to get this value. Provide one of these flags, either '--name' or '--id'.
view.groupBy: Optional. Specifies the grouping of included cases. Available values are: 'condition', 'test-request', or 'ipversion'.
view.hostnameAccessMissing: You don't have access to all the hostnames of included test cases. Those test cases are hidden.

missing.any: Missing one of the required flags, either '--id' or '--name'. Add the flag and try again.

invalid.id: Invalid test suite ID value. It needs to be a number. To get this value, run the 'test-suite list' command. Correct the input and try again.
invalid.groupBy: Invalid '--group-by' flag value. Available values are: 'condition', 'test-request', or 'ipversion'. Correct the input and try again.

remove.long: This command removes a test suite with a specific ID. You can restore removed test suites for 30 days since their removal.
remove.id: Unique identifier for the test suite you want to remove. To get this value, run the 'test-suite list' command. You need to provide either this flag or '--name'.
remove.name: Name of the test suite. To get this value, run the 'test-suite list' command. You need to provide either this flag or '--id'.

restore.long: This command restores a test suite with a specific ID. You can restore removed test suites for 30 days since their removal.
restore.id: Unique identifier for the test suite you want to remove. To get this value, run the 'test-suite list' command. You need to provide either this flag or '--name'.
restore.name: Name of the test suite. To get this value, run the 'test-suite list' command. You need to provide either this flag or '--id'.

missing.any: Missing one of the required flags, either '--id' or '--name'. Provide all required data and try again.

addTestCase.short: Adds a functional test case to a specific test suite.
addTestCase.long: This command adds a functional test case to a test suite with a specific ID.
addTestCase.testSuiteId: Unique identifier for the test suite you want to add test cases to. To get this value, run the 'test-suite list' command. You need to provide either this flag or '--test-suite-name'.
addTestCase.testSuiteName: Name of the test suite you want to add test cases to. You need to provide either this flag or '--test-suite-id'.
addTestCase.url: Fully qualified URL of the resource to test, for example 'https://example.com/'.
addTestCase.addHeader: Optional. Header to be added to the request in the format: 'name: value'.
addTestCase.modifyHeader: Optional. Existing header to be modified in the request in the format: 'name: value'.
addTestCase.filterHeader: Optional. Existing header to be filtered out from the request, specified as 'name'.
addTestCase.condition: Condition statement from the list of supported conditions with entered required values. To get the list of supported conditions, run the 'conditions' command. Make sure to substitute default values in " " with your own. Examples: 'Content provider code is "12345"' or 'Origin server - Cache key hostname is "www.example.com"'.
addTestCase.ipVersion: Optional. IP version to execute the test case over, either 'V4' or 'V6'. It's set to 'V4' by default.

missing.any: Missing at least one of the required flags,'--test-suite-id' or '--test-suite-name', '--url', '--condition'. Provide all required data and try again.

invalid.testSuiteId: Invalid test suite ID value. It needs to be a number. To get this value, run the 'test-suite list' command. Correct the input and try again.
invalid.ipVersion: Invalid IP version value. Available values are 'V4' or 'V6'. Correct the input and try again.
invalid.addHeader: Invalid '--add-header' flag value. Make sure it follows the 'name: value' format and try again.
invalid.modifyHeader: Invalid '--modify-header' flag value. Make sure it follows the 'name: value' format and try again.

removeTestCase.short: Removes a test case from a test suite with a specific ID.
removeTestCase.long: This command removes a specific test case from a test suite with a specific ID.
removeTestCase.testSuiteId: Unique identifier for the test suite you want to remove the test case from. To get this value, run the 'test-suite list' command.
removeTestCase.orderNum: Order number of the test case you want to remove. To get this value, run the 'test-suite view' command for the specific test suite ID.
removeTestCase.success: Test case removed from '%s' test suite
removeTestCase.notPresent: The test case with the order number '%s' can't be found. Run the 'test-suite view' command for the specific test suite ID to check included test cases and try again.
removeTestCase.failed: Failed to remove the test case from '%s' test suite . Try again.

missing.any: Missing at least one of the required flags, '--test-suite-id' and '--order-num'. Provide all required data and try again.

invalid.testSuiteId: Invalid test suite ID value. It needs to be a number. To get this value, run the 'test-suite list' command. Correct the input and try again.
invalid.orderNum: Invalid order number value. It needs to be a number. Run the 'test-suite view' command for the specific test suite ID to check test cases' order number and try again.

authorizationError.requiredPermissionMissing: You don't have the READ permission, which is required to remove test cases. Contact your Account administrator.

read.resourceNotFound: The test suite with this ID could not be found. Run the 'test-suite list' command to make sure the ID is correct and try again.

validationError.resourceInDeletedState: You can't remove test cases from this test suite because it's in the deleted state. Restore it and try again.
validationError.externalApiDataError: At least one property in your account is tied to multiple groups in Control Center. Test Center requires the property to be tied to exactly one group. Contact Akamai technical support to fix this.

authorizationError.requiredPermissionMissing: You don't have the WRITE permission, which is required to access the test suites. Contact your Account administrator.
authorizationError.userIsNotOwnerOrEditor: You don't have the Edit access to the test suite. Request the Edit access using the Test Center UI and try again once your request is approved.
authorizationError.hostnameAccessMissingForAssociatedTestCa: You don't have access to hostnames of at least one test case included in the test suite. Get the access or edit the hostnames and try again.

removeTestCase.resourceNotFound: The test suite with this ID could not be found. Run the 'test-suite list' command to make sure the ID is correct and try again.
removeTestCase.resourceInDeletedState: You can't remove test cases from this test suite because they are in the deleted state. Restore the whole test suite and try again.
removeTestCase.testRunsInProgress: You can't remove test cases involved in a test run in progress. Wait until the test run is complete and try again.
removeTestCase.associationNotFound: Test cases you're trying to remove are not included in this test suite. Run the 'test-suite view' command for the specific test suite ID to check included test cases' and try again.

validationError.resourceInDeletedState: You can't remove test cases from this test suite because the test suite is in the deleted state. Restore it and try again.
validationError.testRunsInProgress: You can't remove the test case involved in a test run in progress. Wait until the test run is complete and try again.
validationError.externalApiDataError: At least one property in your account is tied to multiple groups in Control Center. Test Center requires the property to be tied to exactly one group. Contact Akamai technical support to fix this.

invalid.argumentPassed: Invalid %q subcommand for %q. Correct your input and try again.

spinner.removeTestCase: Removing test case from test suite

invalid.wrongArgumentPassed: Invalid %q subcommand for %q. Correct your input and try again.%s

test.short: Runs a test for a test suite, single test case, or a property version.
test.long: This command runs a test for a specific object. You can run the test for one of the following: a test suite with a specific ID or name, a property version with specific property name and version number, or a combination of URL, condition, and IP version.
test.testSuiteId: Unique identifier for the test suite you want to run the test for. To get this value, run the 'test-suite list' command. To test a test suite, provide either this flag or '--test-suite-name'.
test.testSuiteName: Name of the test suite you want to run the test for. To get this value, run the 'test-suite list' command. To test a test suite, provide either this flag or '--test-suite-id'.
test.url: Fully qualified URL of the resource to test, for example 'https://example.com/'. This flag needs to be combined with '--ip-version' and '--condition' flags.
test.addHeader: Optional. Header to be added to the request in the format: 'name: value'. This flag needs to be combined with '--url', '--ip-version', and '--condition' flags.
test.modifyHeader: Optional. Existing header to be modified in the request in the format: 'name: value'. This flag needs to be combined with '--url', '--ip-version', and '--condition' flags.
test.filterHeader: Optional. Existing header to be filtered out from the request, specified as 'name'. This flag needs to be combined with '--url', '--ip-version', and '--condition' flags.
test.condition: Condition statement from the list of supported conditions with entered required values. To get the list of supported conditions, run the 'conditions' command. Make sure to substitute default values in " " with your own. Examples: 'Content provider code is "12345"' or 'Origin server - Cache key hostname is "www.example.com"'. This flag needs to be combined with '--ip-version' and '--url' flags.
test.ipVersion: Optional. IP version to execute the test case over, either 'V4' or 'V6'. This flag needs to be combined with '--url' and '--condition' flags.
test.property: Property name you want to run the test for, for example 'example.com'. This flag needs to be combined with the '--propver' flag.
test.propver: Property version you want to run the test for, for example '4'. This flag needs to be combined with the '--property' flag.
test.env: Optional. Target environment you want to run the test on, either 'STAGING' or 'PRODUCTION'.
test.testSuiteNameNotFound: The test suite with the name '%s' could not be found. Run the 'test-suite list' command to get this value and try again.
test.testCasesNotFound: The test suite has no test cases included. Add test cases to it and try again.
test.propertyVersionNotFound: The requested property name and version could not be found. Make sure the value is correct and try again.
test.propertyVersionTestSuitesNotFound: The requested property version is not associated with any test suites. Create a new test suite, associate it with the property, and create appropriate test cases, and try again.
test.noTestCases: No test cases to run. Make sure that the property version is associated with test suites that include test cases in them and try again.

missing.flagOrJsonImport: Missing required flags or JSON input. Correct the input following examples and try again.
missing.any: Missing required flags. To run the test for a test suite provide '--test-suite-id' or '--test-suite-name'. To run a test for a property version provide '--property' and '--propver'. To run a test for a single test case provide '--url', '--ip-version' and '--condition' flags.
missing.condition: Missing the required '--condition' flag. Correct the input and try again.
missing.url: Missing required '--url' flag. Correct the input and try again.
missing.propertyVersion: Missing required '--property' and '--propver' flags. Correct the input and try again.

invalid.id: Invalid test suite ID value. It needs to be a number. To get this value, run the 'test-suite list' command. Correct the input and try again.
invalid.propertyVersion: Invalid '--property' or '--propver' flag value. Enter a valid property name and its version and try again. Example: --property 'example.com'  --propver '4'
invalid.ipVersion: Invalid IP version value. Available values are 'V4' or 'V6'. Correct the input and try again.
invalid.addHeader: Invalid '--add-header' flag value. Make sure it follows the 'name: value' format and try again.
invalid.modifyHeader: Invalid '--modify-header' flag value. Make sure it follows the 'name: value' format and try again.
invalid.targetEnvironment: Invalid target environment value. Available values are uppercased 'STAGING' or 'PRODUCTION'. Correct the input and try again.
invalid.exclusive: Invalid request due to incorrect combination of flags. To run the test for a test suite provide '--test-suite-id' or '--test-suite-name'. To run a test for a property version provide '--property' and '--propver'. To run a test for a single test case provide '--url', '--ipversion' and '--condition' flags. Correct the input following examples and try again.

To run a test for a property version provide '--property' and '--propver'. To run a test for a single test case provide '--url', '--ipversion' and '--condition' flags. Correct the input following examples and try again.
validationError.maxTestCasesPerTestRunExceeded: The number of test cases in this test run exceeded the limit of '{{maxLimit}}'. Create another test suite for test cases exceeding the limit and submit another request.
validationError.maxTestSuitesPerTestRunExceeded: The number of test suites in this test run exceeded the limit of '{{maxLimit}}'. Submit another request for the test suites exceeding the limit.
validationError.configVersionNotActive: The property version is not active on the selected environment. Activate it in Property Manager or select a different environment and try again.
validationError.invalidValue: The '{{field}}' is invalid. Correct the value and try again.
validationError.maxLengthExceeded: The '{{field}}' exceeds the allowed characters limit of '{{maxLength}}'.
validationError.hostnameAccessMissing: You don't have access to the hostname. Correct the value and try again.
validationError.urlShouldContainPath: Failed to create a test case for the 'Ignore case in cache key' condition. The URL is missing a path. Edit the URL and try again.
validationError.urlPathShouldContainAlphabeticCharacters: Failed to create a test case for the 'Ignore case in cache key' condition. The URL is missing alphabetic characters. Edit the URL and try again.
validationError.urlShouldContainQueryParam: Failed to create a test case for the 'Ignore case in cache key' condition. The URL is missing query parameters. Edit the URL and try again.
validationError.dataTypeMismatch: The value of a variable in condition doesn't match the expected data type of the condition. Verify the entered condition and the value and try again.
validationError.invalidConditionExpression: This condition is invalid. Verify the entered values, format, and type and try again.
validationError.customValueNotSupported: Invalid condition statement. You can only use default available values for this condition. Use the condition template to create a valid condition and try again.
